definition: senior figure/elder/doyen
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
upper house/senate/senior statesmen's assembly

"the Eight Great Eminent Officials" of the CCP, namely 鄧小平|邓小平[Deng4 Xiao3 ping2], 陳雲|陈云[Chen2 Yun2], 李先念[Li3 Xian1 nian4], 彭真[Peng2 Zhen1], 楊尚昆|杨尚昆[Yang2 Shang4 kun1], 薄一波[Bo2 Yi1 bo1], 王震[Wang2 Zhen4], and 宋任窮|宋任穷[Song4 Ren4 qiong2]/abbr. to 八老[Ba1 lao3]

sentences.english: Anybody who set himself up as king, without being appointed king by the Senate, that was itself an act of treason.
sentences.chinese: 任何人自称为王，而不受元老院册封，那就是叛国罪。

sentences.english: You Catiline, who the consul and the senate shall lead to death.
sentences.chinese: 你，卡提林，执政官和元老院应该让你去死。

sentences.english: The triarch's grotesquerie is in need of a cyvasse-playing dwarf.
sentences.chinese: 元老的滑稽剧团正招聘回下cyvasse的侏儒呢。

sentences.english: Excellent moderators will be awarded a title of "The Vizir".
sentences.chinese: 对于优秀版主，我们将授予“元老”头衔。

sentences.english: The senate of 400 founded by Solon in ancient athens.
sentences.chinese: 古代雅典由梭伦创建的由400人组成的元老院。

sentences.english: She founded the club and is now our doyenne.
sentences.chinese: 她创建了这个俱乐部，现在是我们的元老。

sentences.english: All the three professors have been immerged in the study of paleography for years.
sentences.chinese: 三位教授都是多年研究古文字学的业界元老。

sentences.english: Hence the praetorship remained as the portal through which the sons of senators could enter the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 不过担任财务官仍旧是元老后代进入元老院的门径。

sentences.english: Hence the praetorship remained as the portal through which the sons of senators could enter the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 不过担任财务官仍旧是元老后代进入元老院的门径。

sentences.english: Chung turned to Kim Sang Kwon, a veteran who developed the latest model of the Sonata sedan.
sentences.chinese: 郑求助于开发出最新的索娜塔轿车模型的元老金相权。

sentences.english: From old senators to the new stars, everyone wants Kaka back.
sentences.chinese: 无论是元老还是新星，每个人都想卡卡回来。

sentences.english: Do all these would-be triarchs provide mummer shows?
sentences.chinese: 所有的这些准元老们都提供伶人秀么？

sentences.english: The pontiffs were chosen among the most illustrious of the senators;
sentences.chinese: 主教是从最杰出的元老中选举。

sentences.english: He went on to become one of the doyens of the old China press corps.
sentences.chinese: 他后来成为旧中国新闻界的元老之一。

sentences.english: The majority of Senators continued to be Patricians .
sentences.chinese: 元老院中的成员最后多半成为贵族。

sentences.english: Bohr at 46 was the grand old man.

definition: elder/term of respect for a Buddhist monk
second best person/second-rate person
head (of state)/summit (meeting)/leader
head of a household
direct line of descent/under one's personal command/school or faction passing on faithfully one's doctrine
veteran
Presbyterianism
the imperial family/royal kin
only remaining of the great (idiom); one of the few greats extant
great scholar respected for learning and integrity
newly-appointed/newly elected/new (in a political office)
the most honorable/the most respected/supreme/(archaic) the emperor
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
a person of virtue and prestige/a person of good moral standing and reputation
marshal (in the army)
trusted aide
